metadata.title: CVE-2024-56698 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:usb: dwc3: gadget: Fix looping of queued SG entriesThe dwc3_request->num_queued_sgs is decremented on completion. If apartially completed request is handled, then thedwc3_request->num_queued_sgs no longer reflects the total number ofnum_queued_sgs (it would be cleared).Correctly check the number of request SG entries remained to be prepareand queued. Failure to do this may cause null pointer dereference whenaccessing non-existent SG entry.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
